problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items with their dimensions

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used to pack all items, minimized as objective
Assignment of each item to a box
decision_variables.initialization: item_box_assignments : Annotated[list[Annotated[int, Field(strict=True, ge=1, le=20)]], Len(20, 20)]

decision_variables.description: X and Y positions of each item within their assigned box

objective:
# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))) -> int:
    max_box_id: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS + 1):
        box_id: int = item_box_assignments[i]
        if box_id > max_box_id:
            max_box_id = box_id
    return max_box_id

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)
constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def items_fit_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
) -> None:
    # Constraint: Items must fit exactly in their assigned boxes
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        box_id: int = assignments[i]
        pos: Position = positions[i]
        item: Item = items[i]
        
        # Right edge must not exceed box width
        assert pos.x + item.width <= BOX_WIDTH
        
        # Bottom edge must not exceed box height
        assert pos.y + item.height <= BOX_HEIGHT
        
        # Positions must be non-negative (already constrained by Field definitions)
        assert pos.x >= 0
        assert pos.y >= 0

items_fit_in_boxes(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # Check for non-overlapping conditions
                assert (
                    positions[i].x >= positions[j].x + items[j].width or
                    positions[j].x >= positions[i].x + items[i].width or
                    positions[i].y >= positions[j].y + items[j].height or
                    positions[j].y >= positions[i].y + items[i].height
                )

no_overlap(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_assignment_consistency(
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    x_y_positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
) -> None:
    # Ensure each item is assigned to exactly one box and has a valid position
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        box_id: int = item_box_assignments[i]
        pos: Position = x_y_positions[i]
        
        # Box assignment must be within valid range (already constrained by Field)
        assert box_id >= 1
        assert box_id <= 20
        
        # Position coordinates must be non-negative (already constrained by Field)
        assert pos.x >= 0
        assert pos.y >= 0

ensure_item_assignment_consistency(item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)
full_formulation:
# --- Objects ---


# Object type for an item with width and height
Item = DSRecord({
    "width": DSInt(lb=1, ub=100),
    "height": DSInt(lb=1, ub=100)
})

# Object type for the position (x, y) of an item within a box
Position = DSRecord({
    "x": DSInt(lb=0, ub=100),
    "y": DSInt(lb=0, ub=100)
})

# Object type combining item assignment and its position
ItemAssignment = DSRecord({
    "box_id": DSInt(lb=1, ub=20),
    "position": Position
})



# --- Constants and Decision Variables ---
BOX_HEIGHT : int = 100
BOX_WIDTH : int = 100
ITEMS : DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item) = [
    {"width": 36, "height": 72},
    {"width": 48, "height": 6},
    {"width": 66, "height": 53},
    {"width": 11, "height": 46},
    {"width": 24, "height": 1},
    {"width": 84, "height": 13},
    {"width": 72, "height": 1},
    {"width": 45, "height": 8},
    {"width": 24, "height": 4},
    {"width": 17, "height": 31},
    {"width": 16, "height": 72},
    {"width": 91, "height": 82},
    {"width": 90, "height": 19},
    {"width": 19, "height": 12},
    {"width": 34, "height": 30},
    {"width": 49, "height": 19},
    {"width": 9, "height": 45},
    {"width": 88, "height": 4},
    {"width": 74, "height": 13},
    {"width": 19, "height": 16}
]
nr_used_boxes : DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)
item_box_assignments : DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
x_y_positions : DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
N_ITEMS : int = 20
N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS : int = 20
N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 20


# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))) -> int:
    max_box_id: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS + 1):
        box_id: int = item_box_assignments[i]
        if box_id > max_box_id:
            max_box_id = box_id
    return max_box_id

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)

        assert pos.x >= 0

items_fit_in_boxes(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

# --- constraints ---

    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),

    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):

            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:

def prevent_item_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    x_y_positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box

                    x_y_positions[i].x + items[i].width <= x_y_positions[j].x or

                # If both overlap on x and y axis, there is a conflict
                assert not (x_overlap and y_overlap)

    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
):

    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):

def no_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check items that are in the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # Check if rectangles overlap
                # They do not overlap if one is completely to the left, right, above, or below the other
                assert (
                    positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x or
                    positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x or
                    positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y or

        assert assignments_with_positions[i].box_id == item_box_assignments[i]
        assert assignments_with_positions[i].position.x == x_y_positions[i].x
        assert assignments_with_positions[i].position.y == x_y_positions[i].y

ensure_item_assignment_consistency(item_box_assignments, x_y_positions, assignments_with_positions)

Global problem:

    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used to pack all items, to be minimized
Assignment of each item to a box
decision_variables.initialization: item_box_assignments: Annotated[list[Annotated[int, Field(strict=True, ge=1, le=20)]], Len(20, 20)]

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

ITEMS : DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item) = [{"width": 36, "height": 72}, {"width": 48, "height": 6}, {"width": 66, "height": 53}, {"width": 11, "height": 46}, {"width": 24, "height": 1}, {"width": 84, "height": 13}, {"width": 72, "height": 1}, {"width": 45, "height": 8}, {"width": 24, "height": 4}, {"width": 17, "height": 31}, {"width": 16, "height": 72}, {"width": 91, "height": 82}, {"width": 90, "height": 19}, {"width": 19, "height": 12}, {"width": 34, "height": 30}, {"width": 49, "height": 19}, {"width": 9, "height": 45}, {"width": 88, "height": 4}, {"width": 74, "height": 13}, {"width": 19, "height": 16}]
N_ITEMS : int = 20
nr_used_boxes : DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)
item_box_assignments : DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))

N_ITEMS : int = 20

# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))) -> int:
    max_box: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        box_id: int = assignments[i]
        if box_id > max_box:
            max_box = box_id
    return max_box

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_items_fit_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item_width: int = items[i].width
        item_height: int = items[i].height
        pos_x: int = positions[i].x
        pos_y: int = positions[i].y
        
        # Item must fit within the box boundaries
        assert pos_x + item_width <= box_width
        assert pos_y + item_height <= box_height
        assert pos_x >= 0
        assert pos_y >= 0

ensure_items_fit_in_boxes(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

# --- constraints ---
def prevent_item_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check for overlap if items are in the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # Rectangles overlap if neither is completely to the left, right, above, or below the other
                assert (positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x) or \
                       (positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x) or \
                       (positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y) or \
                       (positions[j].y + items[j].height <= positions[i].y)

prevent_item_overlap(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

def ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    nr_boxes: DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Each item must be assigned to a box within the valid range
        assert assignments[i] >= 1
        assert assignments[i] <= nr_boxes

ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(item_box_assignments, nr_used_boxes)

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.initialization: ITEMS: Annotated[list[Item], Len(20, 20)] = [ITEM1, ITEM2, ITEM3, ITEM4, ITEM5, ITEM6, ITEM7, ITEM8, ITEM9, ITEM10, ITEM11, ITEM12, ITEM13, ITEM14, ITEM15, ITEM16, ITEM17, ITEM18, ITEM19, ITEM20]

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used to pack all items, to be minimized
Assignment of each item to a box
decision_variables.initialization: item_box_assignments: Annotated[list[Annotated[int, Field(strict=True, ge=1, le=20)]], Len(20, 20)]

decision_variables.description: Position of each item within its assigned box

def items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Ensure item fits within the box dimensions
        assert positions[i].x + items[i].width <= box_width
        assert positions[i].y + items[i].height <= box_height
        # Ensure positions are non-negative (already constrained by Field, but included for completeness)
        assert positions[i].x >= 0
        assert positions[i].y >= 0

items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check for overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # Check for non-overlapping conditions
                # If any of these is true, there's no overlap
                # We enforce that at least one of these must be true to avoid overlap
                assert (
                    positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x or
                    positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x or
                    positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y or
                    positions[j].y + items[j].height <= positions[i].y
                )

no_overlap(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)
